WRITING.TEXT: You are welcome. Thanks for understanding where I'm coming from.

I'm not there to house them. I'm there to pick up after them. They could stay and watch if they wanted. Actually some ask for bags and start helping us. They all are not bad people, but majority are. That's just harsh reality.

I totally understand they live there. But I don't get to pick and choose what job I want to do that day. If the project manager says "hey TxDOT is getting a lot of complaints about spur 527 I need you to get your guys and fix the problem." That's what I have to do. If he says "hey 610 north loop has some down exit signs go repair/replace them." Then that's what I have to do.
Edit: I'm not there by choice is what I'm trying to say. Im learning to keep my post and comment short and to the point.

Not anymore. But yet I again I have to say I never tried to solve the major Houston homeless problem. I know the [Sargent here](https://youtu.be/l6BPKLbus1A) personally. Go have a chat with him if you think you have the winning idea. He would sure appreciate it.
Til: People can't seem to differentiate a paragraph

From the sounds of it you've never talked to one. And if you have you've never tried to help them. I have tried and yes they are getting in the way of my job that I get asked to do. You just read and interpret however you seem fit. You seem upset fella. Go make some friends.
Thank you. I should of kept it short and to the point like that. I see my error now.

Actually it was. With the old police chief we got to put up fences and clean up the area. In the middle of that transition is when the new one came in and shut it all down. Go look at their old camp spot. It looks nothing like it used to.
Well I'm truly happy for them. But that's not at all what I said in my post. Other people were chiming in stating I was trying to solve the problem. Do y'all even read the post, or just the comments?
How so? I'm not a social worker nor a case worker. I do my job rather proficiently. Did you even read the original post?
Thank you. Call HPD or city hall. It's going to get way worse without us out there.

Well I didn't get them in that mess. I have my own problems to worry about. I understand the ones with mental issues but when you used to go with a church and TRY to provide them shelter and food and they deny help and they deny viciously then what do you want me to act/feel? I know tons of programs and resources for them but to no avail. 80% to 90% of them want to beg for money to get high and that's the bottom line. Do you know how many times I heard " I make over $100 a day flying a sign" They could move around with that. They get people like you that feel sorry for them and when you leave they laugh at you. Plus I never once mentioned trying to solve the problem. That'll never happen. Can't help someone that doesn't want to help themselves. Just let me do my job and make an honest living so I can feed and protect my family.
Edit: Don't think you are doing them any favors by being an enabler.
Or maybe it's problems that the homeless create?
Jeez. You are a sensitive one. Ok you are not welcome.... better?

Not even worried where they go or what they do. I just want to able to do my job safely. It's already bad when you are on the highway in Houston and all people do is text and drive. I'd like to make it home to my son.

Never once did I mention or even pertain to saying I was trying to solve the homelessness issue but read it how you will. But when your homeless and we keep on moving you and bothering your life then maybe they'll get tired of it and get help for whatever they need help with.
Yeah very poor phrasing. Half asleep. Forgive me

WRITING.TITLE: So the homeless problem is here to stay
WRITING.TEXT:
I work for the state doing highway maintenance. I do all kinds of things like graffiti, damaged guardrail, damaged highway signs etc... So I maintain the 610 loop and every highway inside of it besides 45. One of the things we do is shoo the homeless away and pick up all of their mess. If you've been by Wheeler Station lately you'll see that one popular place is fenced now and cleaned. Your welcome. So obviously we need police presence to do our job safe and it was never a problem to get them to aid us until recently. With this new police chief in town he has put a stop for letting cops be present while we work. The state won't let us work without them and we are the only company that's allowed to move the homeless and clean up after them. Which is really disgusting. So if you guys want to see less homeless and feel safe and clean please contact HPD or city hall and voice your concerns. Until the chief changes his mind the homeless are there to stay.
Edit: Don't read my last sentence. Replace with this --There will always be homeless around but we need law enforcement to help us out just a little to try and make our city look better.
TL;DR Homeless are not going to be moved or their areas will not be cleaned up until the new chief allows his officers to be present like they always were. Bureaucracy at its finest.
Vapordna is legit. Try [8vape](wwe.eightvape.com) they had the best price on my Alien and it got here quick af.

I work for the state doing highway maintenance. So moving the homeless off from the highway is one of our work orders. But we need police presence to do so because we don't get paid enough to get stabbed. Also it something we didn't really sign up for. But when the HPD new police chief came into power he won't send us any cops to get the homeless up and away so we can do our job. I was actually there on Thursday and we got to clean up what we could. So it looks like the homeless are going to stay until TxDOT and HPD can figure something out.
You know you've worked to much when you think of chop saws when he said "echo"

I'll take a few. I have 10 month old son and he is loving when we read to him.
Edit: I'll pm you
Where did you get that case?
Yup

Can't blame the guy/girl. People get robbed here in Houston all the time over stuff like this. Do I think it'll happen on Reddit? Probably not but it's possible. We have to stay vigilant in this city. Good luck finding what you need (wasn't being sarcastic either)

See this is what worries me. She says that she is fine. But I knew it wasn't. Time to try some husband tactics and get her to her doctor.
Edit: Thank you all so much.
Thank you. She has a nephrologist but hasn't seen him in 2+ years

WRITING.TITLE: Wife has PKD (polycystic kidney disease)
WRITING.TEXT: My wife has hereditary PKD and it gets scary at times. Every now and then she has one rupture and then gets bad UTI's. Her father has already been on dialysis twice and I'm afraid she is heading down that road. Is there anything she should not eat or drink. And how does a husband go about supporting her.
Someone sent my wife a free Raspberry Pi 3 case as a Christmas present for me this year. I thought that was awesome and very generous.
That's preposterous. Jk Merry Christmas

I only bundle TV and internet. Monthly cost isn't that bad. I just really need to get my own router/modem. I hate having to pay a rental fee. Also my apartments only allow Comcast. Our customer service has been excellent in all aspects. Absolutely no complaints on my end. Glad you have something you like.
Comcast recently did a upgrade in my area and I get 115/16 much cheaper then Fiber

It does taste off. Maybe it's in our heads.

That's what I was thinking. But why? Yeah her coil looked just like that. They had good tasting juice without the sweeteners. What company do you recommend that doesn't have all of the added ingredients.

I built some coils for her TFV4 rba and she just showed me it's doing the same thing. I pulled out the cotton and it's disgusting and this was one night of use. I really think they changed their recipe.
Think? It's never done this before. And we've used Mitten for over a year. I'm baffled by this little dilemma.
I read that somewhere but it stays inside or in my backpack at work.
Yeah. It's weird. We were thinking maybe they changed their recipes and started to add other ingredients.

WRITING.TITLE: Dark juice
WRITING.TEXT:
So the wife and I are not new to vaping by any means. We just wanted to see the consensus of people's opinion on what could possibly be happening. So we get our juice from Mitten Vapors mainly because it's delicious and claims no sweeteners are added . We've recently got new setups and we are noticing that after a day or two of vaping we are getting the brown streams from the coils. The liquid we use is clear. We have had this problem with other juice companies but never Mitten. Can someone elaborate on what could possibly be going on. Thanks in advance.
Edit: Merry Christmas
Sorry this happened to you OP. Merry Christmas to you as well.
Good eye
I completely understand

This is why I don't participate. I understand it's the season of giving, but when there is a mutual contract and said person doesn't hold up their end of the gift giving then what do you do? I mean I wouldn't lose any sleep over it, but it's just not right.
Lol hand lotion on the nightstand. Sorry I'm immature.
